title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Thursday 8 March - BBC News
summary: arrests over racist chants at university .
corpse sex fetish man has 'extraordinarily low iq ' .
police shake-up planned after city centre violence .
snow warning for drivers in high peak .

documents.title: corpse-sex threat man 'has very low iq '
text: corpse-sex threat man 'has very low iq '

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage has ended for today but some breaking news , sport and travel will continue to appear through the night .
we will be back again at 08:00 .
have a great evening .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: parents could be fined for children 's behaviour
text: parents in swadlincote have been told they could face fines of £ 100 if their children breach anti-social behaviour notices .
sgt graham summers said they handed out several notices over half-term , which if ignored or broken will lead to fines .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: moon exhibition comes to cathedral
text: a large , travelling exhibition known as the museum of the moon is making its way to leicester cathedral tomorrow , marking the start of british science week .
the display is a seven-metre wide representation of the moon , using highly-detailed nasa imagery of the lunar surface .
the exhibition has also toured marseille , new york and hong kong .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: rugby : nottingham name side for dead rubber
text: nottingham boss ian costello has named his side to face ospreys premiership select in the british and irish cup tomorrow evening .
the match was initially supposed to take place in december , but it was snowed off .
josh poullet ( captains the green and whites for the first time , with jack spittle and joe cobden both starting in the back division .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: corbyn meets female business leaders
text: labour leader jeremy corbyn has been visiting female entrepreneurs and business leaders at an event in alfreton .
the gathering , staged to coincide with international women 's day , featured companies from across the east midlands .
author: Tony Roe
BBC East Midlands political editor

documents.title: tigers on red alert after bakewell input
text: tigers on red alert after bakewell input

documents.title: end of the road for homeless service
text: a service for the homeless which won a temporary reprieve from closure has now announced it will shut at the end of the month .
author: Derbyshire Times

documents.title: inquests into explosion deaths opened
text: inquests into explosion deaths opened

documents.title: rapper tweets support for 'racist chants ' student
text: grime star lethal bizzle has tweeted his support for rufaro chisango , who tweeted a video of alleged racist chanting at nottingham trent university .
the london mc retweeted bbc breaking news ' post about two arrests in connection with the alleged racist slurs earlier today along with a black fist emoji .
he also replied to the student 's original tweet asking the university `` what u lot doing about this ? ? ! ? ! ? ! ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ! ''

and thank you .

please explain how the covering up of the muslim grooming gangs in rotherham against underaged girls- and the south african government beating and taking white farmers land- and a black girl who to tortured a white baby to death is `` ignorant bigotry '' ?

documents.title: corpse sex fetish man has 'extraordinarily low iq '
text: a prisoner who threatened to kill a police officer and a judge and have sex with their corpses has challenged his 45-year sentence .
richard ford was serving a 30-month sentence at hmp nottingham for possessing a knife when he made the threats from his cell in january 2016 .

the 39-year-old was jailed for ten counts of making threats to kill a police officer , members of prison staff , a judge , a fellow inmate and a former partner at lincoln crown court in december 2016 .
at the court of appeal today , his barrister , sam robinson argued his sentence should have been less than 10 years - the maximum term for threats to kill .
ford was a man of `` extraordinarily low iq '' , he said , who , having been behind bars for other offences , had become `` institutionalised '' and committed crimes in order to stay in jail .
the judges , led by sir brian leveson , reserved judgment on ford 's appeal until a later date .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: puel : not difficult to reintegrate simpson
text: leicester city manager claude puel says he wo n't have any problems bringing danny simpson back into the side .
simpson was left out of the squad for last weekend 's 1-1 draw with bournemouth , but is set to be recalled with daniel amartey sidelined for a month with a hamstring problem .
`` it 's not difficult , it 's just competition between players .
amartey made good progress in this position .
danny came back from his injury and perhaps needed more time to get back to the right level .
these players are close . ''
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: firm 'unaware ' m1 crash driver unlicensed
text: firm 'unaware ' m1 crash driver unlicensed

documents.title: vice chancellor 'appalled ' at 'racist chants '
text: professor edward peck , the vice chancellor of nottingham trent university , has tweeted about alleged racial slurs aimed at a student in a halls of residence .
rufaro chisango uploaded a video of the apparent abusive chants to twitter while locked in her room .
the university has apologised for delays in responding to the allegations .
all @ twitterid are appalled at this behaviour which will not be tolerated .
the alleged perpetrators have been suspended and a disciplinary inquiry begun .
the police are conducting an investigation and have made arrests .
we are also supporting the complainant and her flatmates .
suspended ? ?
is that it ? ?
they need to be expelled !
make an example of them , this behaviour is never acceptable under any circumstances- ever !
make them pay
excuse me mr edward peck you clearly were not appealed when she went to the reception of her uni and they told her they 'd sort it out the next day .
this is a serious matter .
you people would not have done anything if this had n't gotten media attention .
i 'm so sick of this
that is a lie .
her accommodations is external ( it is not run directly by the university .
the accommodation did not pass on the report to the university till wednesday .
how on earth can the university respond when it wasnt even told ? ?
this disgusting .
what do you mean they have been suspended .
is that it ! ?
these students have terrorised a fellow student and have now made other minority students feel uneasy and unsafe and you 're saying that they have been suspended .
fix this trash asap
has it occurred to you that suspension might be part of a process rather than a sentence ?
after reading more on it , yes it has
i expect them to be kicked out at the end of this investigation- it 's there on camera !
get rid of them .
no place for that in this world .
white supremacy can not be allowed
so why did n't your staff do something immediately ?
the student harassed should be able to move to another dorm .
if her video had n't gotten the responses it got and awaken the feelings , would the university have responded at all ?
not nearly appalled enough incident happened monday and now it 's getting the attention it needs thanks to social media your university sucks bro maybe some senior staff change is required
i 'm a graduate that university , and now doing rather well for myself .
the university has absolutely nothing to do with the way in which drunk students act .
i agree , you are doing rather well , but could be doing better ; a white male in this system does n't make you an authority on a black female 's experience .
lifelong learning perhaps ?
you just lost yourselves a whole load of income from foreign students fees !
why would anyone with brown skin come to @ twitterid
i read in one of the papers that this university has named most of its buildings after white , male academics and industrialists .
internationalism should be part of any university 's agenda .
this is utterly disgusting these students should not be allowed to return
i agree with everyone about the appalling way this student had been treated , and the after care from the university is absolutely shocking .
suspended pending an investigation , leading to those involved being summarily kicked out , i should hope .
i 'd like to think that my alma mater would n't let this kind of behaviour just slide .

my friends daughter had to drop out of law degree because of sectarian/racial abuse more of a problem than @ twitterid are admitting disgraceful in this day and age hate crime must stop @ twitterid what are you doing about this
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: my team-mates stood by me - mahrez
text: my team-mates stood by me - mahrez

documents.title: puel : leicester lack confidence after mahrez saga
text: leicester city manager claude puel has admitted his side have lacked confidence since they rebuffed manchester city 's approach for riyad mahrez .
the foxes have n't won a premier league match since 20 january , a run which began with a 2-1 defeat at everton on transfer deadline day .
`` it was a strange atmosphere around the team , '' said puel .
`` we lack confidence after this game . ''
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: hotel fire : road has reopened
text: trent street and station street reopened after earlier incident .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: guests evacuated after hotel fire
text: i 've just been to the scene of a small fire at the jury 's inn in nottingham .
firefighters told me guests and staff have been temporarily taken to the premier inn hotel on london road .
i 've been told it 's all over now .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: fire at nottingham hotel
text: firefighters are at the scene of a small fire at the jury 's inn near nottingham railway station .
it 's believed to be a small blaze in the station street hotel 's kitchen .
incident on station street @ twitterid on scene , station street and trent street closed .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: university sorry for delayed response to 'racist chants '
text: nottingham trent university has apologised for delays in responding to alleged racist abuse aimed at student rufaro chisango (
it said : `` we are shocked and appalled by this video .
this vile behaviour will not be tolerated at ntu .
`` the suspected perpetrators have been suspended immediately and we have begun an investigation .
`` we are also cooperating fully with the police , who have launched a criminal investigation and have made arrests .
`` it 's clear that there have been delays in dealing with this incident , and that is completely unacceptable .
`` we will work with our accommodation partner to review our processes to ensure this never happens again . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

text: east midlands trains tweets
author: Calum McKenzie

documents.title: building to be lit up for international women 's day
text: nottingham city council tweets
in celebration of # iwd2018 the # nottingham council house @ twitterid will again be lit up purple , white and green tonight for one night only # lovenotts # proud
good to see the tax payers money is being used well .
next thing you will be saying you need more money from us
looks nice but not sure purple and green goes well .
is it for any special reason these colours are chosen
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: lorry breaks down on m1
text: this lorry is currently broken down on the m1 northbound near junction 24 .
it does n't appear to be causing too much disruption and a recovery vehicle is at the scene .

documents.title: hospitals not hitting a & e waiting time targets
text: nottinghamshire 's hospitals are still failing to meet waiting time targets in their accident and emergency departments .
under guidelines 95 % of patients are meant to be seen within four hours .
at the queen 's medical centre , the figure for february was just over 70 % .
for the same period at king 's mill and newark hospitals , it was 89 % .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: high peak snow problems melting away
text: some welcome news for drivers in north derbyshire .
this morning 's snowfall in the high peak is thawing & no more is forecast - hooray !
a6024 holme moss remains closed following a decision by kirklees council to shut the route this morning .
we 'll update you when it re-opens so stay tuned .
errrr
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: should it be womansfield town fc ?
text: manchester city have renamed themselves womanchester city today to mark international women 's day .
they 're among several organisations from the city who have tweaked their names for the occasion .
perhaps mansfield town should follow suit ?
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: badger cull could come to derbyshire
text: derbyshire is among nine counties where land owners have applied for licences to cull badgers in a bid to curb bovine tb .
natural england , which issues the licences , said applications and expressions of interest had come from areas of `` high risk '' or those nearby .
culling is part of the government 's 25-year strategy to eradicate the disease in cattle , but opponents say there is no evidence it works .
the licences allow badgers to be killed every year between 1 june and 31 january .

derbyshire wildlife trust , which started vaccinating badgers on its nature reserves as an alternative to culling in 2014 , said it remained `` steadfast that vaccinating badgers is the alternative to a badger cull '' .
it added if the cull came to derbyshire it `` would not be allowed '' on its land .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'leicester set standard for forwards '
text: 'leicester set standard for forwards '

documents.title: video shows 'we hate blacks ' chant
text: video shows 'we hate blacks ' chant

documents.title: greggs uses 'bouncers ' to prevent late-night trouble
text: greggs in nottingham is employing 'bouncers ' to keep late-night revellers in check .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: ireland call-up for rams defender
text: derby county defender alex pearce has been named in republic of ireland 's provisional squad for a friendly against turkey .
manager martin o'neill has called up 30 players for the match later this month .
if he plays , it will be pearce 's 10th international cap .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: girl , 11 , dies after being struck by loose wheel
text: an 11-year-old girl who was hit by a wheel that came off a passing car has died at the queen 's medical centre in nottingham .
it is believed amelia wood was walking alongside a road in manby , lincolnshire , on tuesday morning when a wheel fell off a land rover discovery .
police said they were still investigating how the wheel came off .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: only fools and horses ' boycie gets panto role
text: only fools and horses star john challis will be coming to nottingham later this year for a pantomime role .
challis , known to millions as boycie , will be be captain hook in the theatre royal 's christmas panto , peter pan .
he will be joined by comedian joe pasquale .
peter pan at the theatre royal is set to run from saturday 8 december to sunday 13 january 2019 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: signalling fault causes rail delays
text: east midlands trains tweets
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: 'no place for racism in our city ' says mp
text: labour mp alex norris has described apparent racist chanting at nottingham trent university as `` horrendous '' .
rufaro chisango tweeted the video of the alleged abuse while locked in her room at her halls of residence on wednesday .
two men , both aged 18 , have since been arrested on sus of racially aggravated public order offences .
mr norris , the mp for nottingham north , added that there was `` no place '' for racism `` in our city - or anywhere else '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: forest players help pay for fan displays
text: nottingham forest 's players and staff have decided to contribute to upcoming supporter displays , according to captain ben watson .
watson , 32 , said the club wanted to help make the city ground `` a fortress '' after fans battled wintry weather to make it to the game against birmingham city last weekend .
forest 's next match is against local rivals derby county on sunday .
despite the difficult weather conditions over the past week , you came out in force last saturday when i am sure it would have been easier to stay at home .
with that in mind myself , the staff and the rest of the players have made a contribution towards various upcoming supporter displays .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: badger cull may expand to nine new areas
text: badger cull may expand to nine new areas

documents.title: tributes paid to teacher and former derby footballer
text: tributes have been paid to head of pe at mackworth school and former rams centre-forward ray wilkins .
author: Derby Telegraph

text: broxtowe mp anna soubry tweets
@ rufarochisango like me people in & around nottingham # broxtowe are appalled & disgusted by this racist , intimidating and yobbish behaviour .
this is not ty of the overwhelming majority of @ twitterid students .
pleased @ twitterid investigating - let 's see action .
i suppose it 's all the fault of brexit
not directly but the rise of far right populist ideologies driving the brexit agenda gives the racist bigots a deplorable sense of immunity .
i suppose this is another of your token tweets supporting causes you really have little interest in .
you in the bar again
name calling get a f= % '' & life

author: Calum McKenzie

documents.title: robin hood pageant set to return
text: preparations are under way for the return of the robin hood pageant at nottingham castle this weekend .
the event was cancelled in october due to hurricane warnings .
visitors can see what 12th century nottingham was like , with demonstrations of period cooking , jousting and archery .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: rail ticket machine problem resolved
text: pre-booked tickets can once again be collected at stations in the east midlands .
morning everyone , peter here .
due to a nationwide fault with ticket machines , you wo n't be able to collect your tickets from the station at the mo .
you 'll be able to board our trains with your booking confirmation emails until this has been fixed .
update : the fault has now been fixed and machines are now working again .
please collect your tickets before travelling .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: homes still without water in buxton and ashbourne
text: severn trent is continuing to give out bottled water to people in buxton and ashbourne who remain without tap water following a number of pipe bursts earlier this week .
the firm said the situation had `` vastly improved '' overnight and water had been restored to more properties .
it said anyone still without running water can up free bottles from ashbourne 's shawcroft car park , sudbury hall and buxton market place .
bottles are also being delivered to homes in rural parts of buxton .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: breakingtwo men arrested over 'we hate blacks ' video
text: two 18-year-old men have been arrested on sus of racially-aggravated public order offences after a video was made public showing apparent racist abuse at nottingham trent university .
nottinghamshire police said the pair remain in custody as their investigation continues .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: cricket : notts complete ross taylor signing
text: nottinghamshire have signed new zealand international ross taylor as their overseas player for the first half of the season .
taylor , 34 , has agreed a deal at trent bridge until the end of june , meaning he can play in eight county championship matches and all eight royal london one-day cup pool games .
should the outlaws progress to the quarter-finals and beyond , taylor would be available to return to take part in those matches too .
he has had two previous stints in county cricket , with durham ( 2010 ) and sussex ( 2016 , 2017 ) .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: tigers trio selected for six nations clash
text: leicester tigers dan cole , george ford and jonny may have kept their places in the england side for saturday 's six nations clash against france .
may moves from the left to the right wing as part of a switch in the back three after england 's 25-13 defeat in scotland .
england head coach eddie jones has made three changes in total , with captain dylan harley ruled out through injury .
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: 'racist chant ' video 'shocking to see in 2018 '
text: mary okpo , from nottingham trent university 's afro-caribbean society , has described a video of apparent racist chants being shouted in a halls of residence as `` unacceptable '' and `` unjustifiable '' .
she told the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme : `` whether they were inebriated or not , there 's nothing that can justify what they said .
`` she [ rufaro chisango ] clearly was in a state of distress .
this could have affected her incredibly but she 's a strong girl so she has come through with our support and the support of her friends and family .
`` it 's something i did n't think i 'd see .
i 've always had an idea that racism is covert but for it to be so overtly open in 2018 , it 's something that 's really shocked me . ''
nottingham trent university has said in a statement that the `` suspected perpetrators '' had been suspended pending a full investigation .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: police to investigate university 'racist chants ' video
text: nottinghamshire police are also investigating the video that appears to show racist abuse aimed at a black student at nottingham trent university .
in a statement , the force said : `` we are aware of a video posted at nottingham trent university and which has been shared on social media .
`` it is wholly unacceptable and we 're proactively investigating the incident and liaising with the university .
we treat hate crime extremely seriously and we would always urge anyone who has been the victim of or a witness to hate crime to report it . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area
text: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area

documents.title: student 's shock at 'racist chanting ' at university halls
text: rufaro chisango told the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme the apparent racist abuse she had received at her nottingham trent university halls of residence had left her feeling `` shocked , isolated and uncomfortable '' .
she said : `` when it happened , i 'd just got home and about five , ten minutes later i heard shouting outside my door .
`` after they left i went to reception and complained there was racial abuse outside my corridor .
they took a statement , took down my details and stuff , and said they 'd get back to me by the morning .
`` i just want the appropriate action to be taken .
obviously it should n't be tolerated at all . ''
she also told her twitter followers the abuse had left her feeling `` fuming '' and `` sad '' .
nottingham trent university said in a statement that the `` suspected perpetrators '' had been suspended pending a full investigation .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: weimann left puzzled by derby county 's poor form
text: derby county striker andreas weimann says he ca n't put his finger on the reason behind the team 's current winless run .
the rams have failed to record a victory in their past six matches - but the austrian thinks their next three points are n't too far away .
he said : `` it 's a bit weird as we 're not playing badly .
it just seems it 's not falling for us at the minute .
`` we 've just got to keep going and try to turn it around .
i think we need an ugly win . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: students suspended over 'racist chants ' video
text: nottingham trent university says a number of students have been suspended after a video was posted online that appeared to show a black student being racially abused at her halls of residence .
the footage , which rufaro chisango said was recorded on monday night , features at least two males voices chanting outside the front door of her university accommodation .
the video received wide condemnation after being shared online .
in a statement , the university said : we are shocked and appalled to see the video of racist chanting posted yesterday evening .
this kind of vile behaviour will not be tolerated at nottingham trent university .
`` those suspected perpetrators have been suspended immediately pending a full investigation .
`` we have contacted the student who made the complaint and are providing support to her and others affected .
and we are liaising with the police about this incident . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snowy rooftops in stoney middleton
text: still looking very wintry in stoney middleton this morning .
thanks to sam 's house for the
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police shake-up planned after city centre violence
text: new measures are due to be announced later aimed at tackling a rise in crime in nottingham city centre .
notts police and crime commissioner paddy tipping is expected to announce a new superintendent will take charge of city policing next month .
chief constable craig guildford said the restructure would provide `` something similar '' to the old city division , which was scrapped two years ago .
the move follows a number of violent incidents in and around the victoria centre , including a mass brawl and an assault that left a woman in a coma .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: owner reunited with car she was unaware had been stolen
text: police returned a woman 's stolen car to her yesterday - only to discover she was unaware it had been taken .
the jaguar f-type was stolen from the woman 's home in strelley early yesterday but was found by officers in quarry avenue , bulwell , a short time later .
police are now appealing for help in tracking down the thief , who was seen fleeing from the car .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: warning for drivers as more snow arrives in high peak
text: drivers have been warned many routes in the high peak area are likely to become impassable today due to heavy snow showers in north derbyshire .
the county council said only one road was currently closed - the a6024 holme moss - but conditions were likely to become increasingly difficult on others .
it said its gritters and snow ploughs had been deployed to try to make life easier for drivers .
there are currently no school closures listed on the council 's website .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: driver causes two-car crash after swerving to avoid fox
text: two cars crashed into the central reservation on the a50 near sudbury last night after a driver swerved to avoid hitting a fox .
police said a peugeot hit the barrier when it steered around the animal and a skoda also crashed as it swerved to avoid the car .
thankfully neither driver was injured .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: ticket machine problem at railway stations
text: something to be aware of if you 're planning to get a train this morning .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: half of drivers get parking fines cancelled
text: almost half of drivers who challenged parking and bus lane fines issued by local authorities were successful , figures obtained by the bbc suggest .
chesterfield borough council ( 50 % ) and newark and sherwood district council ( 43 % ) had the region 's highest rate of successful appeals over the past five years .
elsewhere the figure was 38 % in derby , 30 % in notts and 26 % in leicester .
councils say it proves their appeals process works .
the full list is here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's how we 're expecting thursday to pan out .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for today 's live updates
text: good morning everyone .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the east midlands throughout the day .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
